node.title: BOM summer outlook: It will pay to check for floods before setting out this summer
node.alt: A sign warns of water over a road
node.description: Thanks to the La Niña, finally announced on Tuesday, conditions are expected to be wetter than average for parts of the east coast this summer, according to the Bureau of Meteorology's official summer outlook.
node.content:
["Thanks to the La Ni\u00f1a, finally announced on Tuesday, conditions are expected to be wetter than average for parts of the\u00a0east coast this summer, according to the Bureau of Meteorology's official summer outlook.\u00a0", "But with the climate driver to the west, the negative Indian Ocean Dipole, dying out,\u00a0the centre\u00a0is expecting\u00a0a fairly normal summer in terms of rainfall.\u00a0", "But while it might not end up being\u00a0the wettest summer on record for Australia as a whole,\u00a0with many catchments around the country already primed, it won't take much to trigger flooding this summer.", "", "
This summer is expected to be wetter than average for parts of the east but relatively normal through the centre.\u00a0\u00a0(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "\"Spring has been wetter than normal and, as a result, soil moisture is high, water storages are full,\u00a0and we've seen flooding\u00a0in some areas,\" says\u00a0Andrew Watkins, head of the bureau's operational climate services.\u00a0", "
NSW dam's\u00a0dramatic turnaround
", "In New South Wales, the dams are overflowing.\u00a0", "According to Tony Webber\u00a0from Water New South Wales, it is a dramatic turnaround in water security from the worst years of the drought.\u00a0", "\"That was only the end of the summer of 2019/2020,\" he says.\u00a0\u00a0", "Many of the dams that were empty or nearly empty are now overflowing.\u00a0", "\"Keepit Dam on the Namoi \u2014 that's now at capacity and spilling into the Namoi River \u2014 was dry for 14 months. Burrendong \u2014 that's at 128 per cent, but fell to 1.5 per cent,\" Mr Webber says.", "", "
Pelicans at Lake Pamamaroo are among the dozens of species benefiting from floodwaters that arrived in April.(ABC News: Niall Lenihan)
", "The other big turnaround in the past few years has been flow returning to the Darling\u00a0River, which has now been\u00a0experiencing connected flow for many months and the Menindee Lakes are\u00a0at capacity.", "\"There are releases occurring into the Lower Darling and the anabranch as we speak,\" Mr Webber says.", "The turnaround has certainly been fantastic for water supply but it's obviously not all good news.\u00a0", "\"The flooding is certainly most regrettable and the damage to the crops across many areas of the state at harvest time\u00a0is\u00a0quite heartbreaking for not just the farmers\u00a0but everybody across the region,\" Mr Webber says.", "\"But in the longer term, the water security that we will have for communities, for agriculture, for the environment, is probably the best we've seen in at least a decade.\"\u00a0\u00a0", "Keeping up with the flows if this kind of rain keeps up is going to be an ongoing challenge.\u00a0", "\"Given that the majority of these storages that are at or about capacity, it'll just be an ongoing operational pattern that we've been in for weeks, if not months,\" he says.", "\"Waiting for a window between the rain events to lower the storage so that we're in a position to try to capture as much of the follow-up rain event on a wet catchment into a dam that's near capacity\u00a0and releasing into rivers that are very high.\"\u00a0", "", "
Copeton Dam \u2014\u00a0the biggest in the New England North West \u2014\u00a0spills for the first time in nine\u00a0years.(Supplied: Joe Varani)
", "
Murray-Darling Basin awash\u00a0
", "Given that NSW makes up a large proportion of the catchment,\u00a0it is therefore not a huge surprise that the Murray-Darling Basin is also awash.\u00a0", "According to the Murray-Darling Basin Authority executive director of river management, Andrew Kremor,\u00a0the\u00a0Murray-Darling Basin storages have already\u00a0surpassed 2016 levels to reach 93 per cent.", "\"All this extra water in the system means flows into South Australia have also doubled in 12 months,\" he says.", "\"This time last year they were around 17GL a day and were around 34GL a few days ago,\" he said.", "Flowing on, South Australia's water stores have\u00a0also seen an increase in inflows this year.\u00a0", "\"Natural inflow from winter rains have been higher this year when compared to the previous three years, largely influenced by high rainfall in July,\" according to a spokesperson from SA Water.\u00a0", "SA Water's reservoirs are currently sitting around 73 per cent \u2014 average for this time of year.\u00a0", "Even more dramatically, Western Australia has also seen a big uptick in its water stores\u00a0thanks to plenty of winter rain \u2014 up to 62.1 per cent of capacity from just 27.2 per cent last year.", "", "
This is the first time since 2016 there has been enough water to open the gates between Lake Pamamaroo and Lake Menindee (pictured).(ABC News: Nathan Morris)
", "Meanwhile, Victoria has jumped from 67.3 to just over 85 per cent and the Northern Territory saw a decent boost during\u00a0last year's wet season.\u00a0", "
More to come in Queensland\u00a0
", "Overall, Queensland's water stores are up from 47.6 per cent this time last year to 54.4 per cent and the SEQ water grid is sitting at 55.5 per cent.\u00a0", "", "
Queensland has certainly been getting some heavy rain but it is taking a while for the water to trickle through to the dams.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "It may be\u00a0taking a while for\u00a0catchments to start generating runoff from recent rain but if the outlook comes to fruition this summer\u00a0those numbers would certainly be expected to rise.\u00a0", "Aside from the rain, the first cyclone of the season has already burst into being and more than average are expected this year.", "High overnight temperatures could also lead to gruelling heatwaves.", "
Summer fire outlook
", "Just because it is wet in one region does not prevent fires in another.\u00a0", "This year's bushfire outlook suggests a below average risk for parts of the NSW coast but above average for the interior.\u00a0", "", "
Parts of the east coast might be expecting below normal fire potential this year but fire is still an above normal\u00a0risk for parts of the west and inland NSW.\u00a0(Supplied: AFAC)
", "High growth following the recent rain is expected to dry out as the summer goes on upping the risk.", "Likewise in WA\u00a0grass growth is up and\u00a0above average temperatures are also expected to help dry things out.\u00a0", "As always, a normal fire risk for the rest of the country does not rule out fire. A normal Australian summer has fires.", "", "
Daytime temperatures are expected to be below average for parts of the southern and east coast but above average elsewhere. Overnight temperatures are expected to be broadly above average.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
"]
